questions.answer: It was a political movement demanding the formation of a separate state for Marathi-speaking people, including regions like Mumbai, Vidarbha, and Marathwada.

questions.question: When did the movement for Samyukta Maharashtra begin?
Who was N.C. Kelkar?
questions.answer: N.C. Kelkar was a scholar and journalist who in 1911 advocated for the unification of all Marathi-speaking people under one dominion.

questions.question: What resolution was passed at the Sahitya Sammelan in Belgaon in 1946?
questions.answer: A resolution supporting the formation of Samyukta Maharashtra was passed.

questions.question: What was the Maharashtra Ekikaran Parishad?
questions.answer: It was a council formed on 28 July 1946 in Mumbai to demand the inclusion of all Marathi-speaking regions in one state.

questions.question: Who chaired the Dar Commission?
questions.answer: The Dar Commission was chaired by Justice S.K. Dar.

questions.question: What was the main recommendation of the Dar Commission?
questions.answer: It recommended the formation of linguistic provinces, but the issue remained unresolved.

questions.question: Who were the members of the JVP Committee?
questions.answer: Jawaharlal Nehru, Vallabhbhai Patel, and Pattabhi Sitaramayya.

questions.question: What did the JVP Committee report say?
questions.answer: It said that the Congress accepted the concept of linguistic states in principle, but the time was not right for their formation.

questions.question: Who organized rallies to awaken people during the movement?
What proposal did Acharya Atre get passed in the Mumbai Municipal Corporation?
questions.answer: He got passed the proposal for Samyukta Maharashtra including Mumbai.

questions.question: What was the Fazal Ali Commission?
questions.answer: It was the Commission for Reconstruction of States, appointed in 1953, which advocated for a bilingual Mumbai State.

questions.question: What was the Nagpur Pact?
questions.answer: It was a pact signed in 1953 that assured equitable development, financial provisions, and annual assembly sessions in Nagpur for the proposed Samyukta Maharashtra.

questions.question: Which article was added to the Constitution as per the Nagpur Pact?
What did Shankarrao Dev say about Mumbai's inclusion in Maharashtra?
questions.answer: He said, 'We will oppose the separation of Mumbai from Maharashtra up to our last breath.'

questions.question: Name some women who participated in the movement.
questions.answer: Sumatibai Gore, Ismat Chugtai, Durga Bhagwat, Tara Reddi, Charusheela Gupte, Kamalatai More, and Sultana Johari.

questions.question: What happened on 7 November 1955?
questions.answer: A large labour meeting was held in Mumbai, presided over by Comrade Shripad Amrut Dange, where a resolution for Samyukta Maharashtra with Mumbai and Vidarbha was proposed.

questions.question: Who led the grand march to the Vidhan Sabha?
What action did the police take during the march?
questions.answer: The police used lathi charge and tear gas.

questions.question: When was the Samyukta Maharashtra Samiti established?

questions.answer: It was formed at Tilak Smarak Mandir in Pune.

questions.question: Who was the President of the Samyukta Maharashtra Samiti?
questions.answer: Comrade Shripad Amrut Dange was the President.

questions.question: Who was the General Secretary?
questions.answer: S.M. Joshi was the General Secretary.

questions.question: Name some leaders who played important roles in the Samiti.
questions.answer: G.T. Madkholkar, Acharya P.K. Atre, Madhu Dandavate, Prabodhankar Keshav Thackeray, Y.K. Souni, Senapati Bapat, and Krantisinh Nana Patil.

questions.question: Which newspapers supported the movement?
questions.answer: Prabodhan, Kesari, Sakal, Navakal, Navyug, Prabhat, and Maratha.

questions.question: Who spread the movement to rural Maharashtra?
How many people became martyrs in the movement?
What is Hutatma Smarak?

What was the outcome of the 1957 elections?
questions.answer: The Samyukta Maharashtra Samiti achieved grand success, showing public support for a united Maharashtra.

questions.question: What demonstration was planned on 30 November 1957?
questions.answer: A huge demonstration was planned during the unveiling of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's statue on Pratapgad by Prime Minister Nehru.

questions.question: Who led the demonstration?
questions.answer: Bhai Madhavrao Bagal led it, with leaders like S.M. Joshi, N.G. Gore, Jayantrao Tilak, P.K. Atre, and Uddhavrao Patil.

When did the Parliament pass the Mumbai Reorganisation Act?

questions.question: Who became the first Chief Minister of Maharashtra?
questions.answer: Yashwantrao Chavan became the first Chief Minister.

questions.question: What was the role of the press in the movement?
questions.answer: Newspapers played a crucial role in awakening public opinion, spreading information, and mobilizing support for the movement.

questions.question: Why was the Fazal Ali Commission's proposal controversial?
questions.answer: It proposed a bilingual Mumbai State, which was opposed by Marathi-speaking people who wanted Mumbai in a unilingual Maharashtra.

questions.question: What was the significance of the Nagpur Pact?
questions.answer: It unified Marathi-speaking regions and provided assurances for balanced regional development within the proposed state.

questions.question: How did the movement gain mass participation?
questions.answer: Through public meetings, rallies, strikes, participation of women, labour unions, and the use of media and folk arts like Shahiri.

questions.question: What was the impact of the 1957 election results?
questions.answer: The victory of the Samyukta Maharashtra Samiti demonstrated clear public mandate against the bilingual state and in favour of a unified Maharashtra.

questions.question: How did the movement finally succeed?
questions.answer: Due to persistent mass agitation, political pressure, electoral victory of the Samiti, and support from leaders like Indira Gandhi, the Central Government agreed to create Maharashtra.

questions.question: What regions were to be included in Samyukta Maharashtra?
questions.answer: Western Maharashtra, Vidarbha, Marathwada, and Marathi-speaking areas of Mumbai and Central Provinces.

questions.question: What does 'Samyukta Maharashtra' mean?
Why was Mumbai's inclusion important?
questions.answer: Mumbai was the economic and cultural capital of Marathi-speaking people, and its inclusion was seen as vital for the identity and viability of the new state.

questions.question: What was the contribution of folk artists to the movement?
questions.answer: Shahirs and folk artists used songs, poems, and performances to spread the movement's message, inspire masses, and document the struggle.

questions.question: How is 1 May celebrated in Maharashtra?
questions.answer: It is celebrated as Maharashtra Day, marking the formation of the state on 1 May 1960.
